artist: Artist: Attributed to Jean-Pierre Norblin de la Gourdaine
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: bust of long-haired man with large, gaping mouth; wears tall, crooked hat with ties hanging to shoulders, and thick overcoat with rolled collar
inscription:
Inscription

-- lettered in plate at upper left, partially erased: [Rembrandt ft]
-- in graphite on verso: APG 6780
provenance: [C. & J. Goodfriend, New York; sold November 26, 1985, to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Grotesque Head of a Man in a Tall Bonnet
